comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I believe you already know about the forum since your first post is in a merit thread. But nonetheless welcome to Bitcointalk.org, and just a tip no one can help you know more about the forum if you’re not ready to learn, because we’re going to do is to try and share some useful links with you, you’ll be the one doing all the studying partLet’s start with the rules of the forum, that will help you recognize the DOs and DON’Ts of the forum. So check it out here. And next would be for you to learn about bitcoin and crypto, if you’re to participate in discussions here you’ll be needing knowledge on such topics so do well to go through the toll links as they’ll help you learn some basic information to help you get started.  https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/ https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Beginners & Encyclopaedia

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I do not know whether the problem is that the forum is difficult to find good topics, or that beginners today are more keen on education and searching for sources, but the best advice you can learn is how to search properly in the forum and on Google. If you learn that, then you will find that 90% of the questions What concerns you has already been answered, and the 10% you can state here.Learning this will open the door for you to thousands of topics similar to ours that you are looking for.
